page.title: 06A DAY AT THE "TATTIES"
page.content: In our area, it is possible to make extra pocket money at different times of the year. In October we get a two week holiday and many people go potato picking, otherwise known as "tattie howkin'". You have to be up about 6.20a.m to be ready for a day at the tatties.I get a lift up to the field on the back of a trailor. We start work at 7.15 in the morning and work right through to 8.30. We get a about 20 minutes for a "piecie time", then back to work.You have to work quite quickly because the men who throw the tatties into the trailer do not care if your back is sore. At 12.00 we have our lunch.This break lasts for half an hour.The last break is at 3.20 and ends at 3.30. About 15 minutes from the end the gaffer comes round with the money.
